Articles.Content:
Hey guys/gals,

For my first post I thought I'd ask a question which will seem interesting to some (I hope); what kinda music if any do you listen to while playing KSP? I'd imagine mostly movie scores would be popular.

If I feel like KSP is getting too quiet I put on the soundtrack from the movie Mission to Mars, cheesy I know but does the trick haha

Cheers
I just listen to music i like over a subscription streaming music service.

Well I've been listening to

Eluveitie albums while playing KSP or Gangnam Style on repeat
My favorite - http://somafm.com/missioncontrol/

It depends on my current video game obsession. Earlier this year it was the Zelda Orchestra CD that came with Skyward Sword. Currently it's music from Persona 3, and it's been like that for the past month and a half. I suspect my next playlist will be composed of Persona 2 music.
Mogwai and Bonobo, or anything chill like that. Sometimes some Blockhead, it really sets the mood for the void that is space.

Normally nothing, funnily enough. I find I need to concentrate when playing the game, and I sometimes get distracted when listening to something.

eg. Okay, aerobrake until 1000m altitude and then- oh, this is a good song, isn't it? Oh wai-KABOOOOM

Or something like that.

Normally nothing, funnily enough. I find I need to concentrate when playing the game, and I sometimes get distracted when listening to something.

eg. Okay, aerobrake until 1000m altitude and then- oh, this is a good song, isn't it? Oh wai-KABOOOOM

Or something like that.

Haha yeah man I can see that happening actually, the amount of times I've missed Jool because of it is crazy
during launch i like to listen to laibach's b mashina. during a bad launch i like to listen to arcturus's shipwrecked frontier pioneer, for orbital transfers i just play the blues on my guitar.

I mostly listen to game or movie soundtracks, here are a few:

Assassins Creed (II, Brotherhood, Revelations)

Black Hawk Down

Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2

Deus Ex: Human Revolution

Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

Firefly

Gladiator

Mass Effect (1, 2, 3)

Cosmos

October Sky

Serenity

The Witcher 2
my favorite is the total relaxation of my engine burning while heading to duna

when not listening to the engines one-long-song, then i listen to whatever's playing on the background of my hyperactive head

when all else fails, Metallica!

theres always hank 3 and marduk, with some cash, coe and sarcofago hank sr. and celtic frost thrown in for good measure.

country and black metal for the win

Edited October 6, 2012 by Nuke

I listen to soundtracks of games, cause I don't like music with singing people

some examples:

(Mostly used for launch)

(Mostly used when I work with satellites)

sometimes metroid-prime music is an option too

First time I landed on Laythe ground I was listen to this:

But I also listen to some other music:

(When something is going very, very wrong ^^) Edited October 6, 2012 by KCST
Somtimes Kerrang radio http://radioplayer.kerrangradio.co.uk/ when the presenter starts to annoy me i mostly put on some Tool, Iron maiden, Deftones, Faith no more, Pearl Jam. whatever really.

I'm listening to Mass Effect 3 Extended Cut An End Once And For All while in deep space and when I have landed on another body.

During launch and landing, probably nothing.

Pink Floyd - Dark side of the moon is my soundtrack to any mun mission.

Also, I'd love to know what the KSP Credits music is. I want to listen to that in a mission.

I've been playing this lately for launches.

It kinda fits with where they usually end up.

Hehe, I use that same station myself a lot. But if it's not that, it's a collection of music ranging from Kohachiro Miyata to Iron Maiden...

Edited October 7, 2012 by Panichio
My usual in-game soundtracks:

I usually listen to XMAS music, because there's nothing like listening to Have A Holly Jolly Christmas when you're performing gravity turns and Silver Bells when you're watching your newly orbiting satellite performing it's duties.
I always listen to Danger Zone off the Top Gun album

Pink Floyd - Echoes, all of Dark Side of the Moon and Shine on You Crazy Diamond.

Echoes is great if you've played it over 2011 before.

theres always the 2001 soundtrack or wagners ring cycle

*runs*
